title: DOC:`quarkus.openshift.arguments` and `quarkus.openshift.command` doesn't have a proper description
body:
### Describe the bug

The provided description on [this site](https://quarkus.io/guides/deploying-to-openshift)  about `quarkus.openshift.arguments` and `quarkus.openshift.command` are poor. I guess that `quarkus.openshift.arguments` talks about the program arguments. In case of a JVM mode would be the main argument that a developer could pass to their apps, and in the case of a Native app would be the program args. 

Regarding `quarkus.openshift.command` I am not sure what does mean, I guess that must be the container command in case you want to overwrite the default one, so in the case of a JVM app could be something like: `java -Dquarkus.http.host=0.0.0.0 -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.jboss.logmanager.LogManager -jar /deployments/quarkus-run.jar`

In both cases are missing a proper description on the following sites:
- https://quarkus.io/guides/deploying-to-openshift
- https://quarkus.io/guides/all-config
